visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing agricultural production comparison across major producers using grouped columns with data labels and perceptual color contrast

subtitle.text: Source: Synthetic data modeling USDA estimates

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two quantitative variables (corn/wheat production) across 12 categorical entities (countries). Synthetic data extends USDA estimates using normal distribution (corn: μ=85,000, σ=120,000; wheat: μ=65,000, σ=50,000) maintaining rank-order consistency. Column charts effectively enable magnitude comparisons through positioned rectangles, adhering to Tufte's principle by maximizing data-ink through direct value labels. Cairo's color contrast principles (light corn vs dark wheat) create immediate categorical distinction. Production clusters show North/South American corn dominance (USA-Brazil-Argentina) versus Eurasian wheat specialization (China-EU-Russia), with synthetic values maintaining regional production patterns.
